intro: Diphysa spinosa, commonly known as the spiny diphysa, is a member of the family Malvaceae. It is a shrub characterized by its spiny stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is native to regions of South America, particularly Brazil. Diphysa spinosa is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
